page.title: 12Wildlife
page.content: a{disused railway}which formerly linked the communities of Rhuddlan and Saint Asaph to the seaside resort of Rhyl. This railway was closed in the 1950s A wide variety of{birdlife}is found in the area, ranging from common birds of town and garden to the herons which patrol the banks of the river and the sparrowhawks and other birds of prey which are frequently seen in the area. Several species of waterbird, including a nesting pair of swans inhabit the{small lake},some 40m wide and 15m wide which is to be found alongside the dual carriageway on the outskirts of Rhuddlan. Several species os small mammal, reptile, and amphibian are also to be found in the area.
